definition: bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: Its been ten years since i last visited, a little nostalgia swept over me.
sentences.chinese: 从我上次去那里已经有十年了，怀旧感席卷了我。

sentences.english: I'm hoping to invoke a sense of nostalgia with "Childhood Sweethearts."
sentences.chinese: 我希望援引甜心童年的怀旧感以”。

sentences.english: Add a bit of nostalgia to your home with country wallpaper and wall border.
sentences.chinese: 用乡村壁纸和墙壁边缘给你的家增添点怀旧感吧。

sentences.english: Why does a train whistle bring on a feeling of nostalgia?
sentences.chinese: 为何火车鸣笛声会带来怀旧感？

sentences.english: There is also a special class of car owners - the sentimental.
sentences.chinese: 此外，还有另一族群的车主，就是怀旧感伤的车主。

definition: to return to old ways (a Confucian aspiration)/to turn back the clock/neoclassical school during Tang and Song associated with classical writing 古文/retro (fashion style based on nostalgia, esp. for 1960s)
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
a sense of having been through good times and bad/a weathered and worn look
implicit charm in rhyme or sound/hinted appeal/interest
qualities that delight children (e.g. bold colors in a picture, anthropomorphized characters in a TV show, the physical challenge of playground equipment)
interesting and appealing (of old locations, objects etc)
style (of art or literature)/form/one's work style/moral character
Qingxin county in Qingyuan 清远, Guangdong
